slidelink.displaytext: Ways to prevent slips and trips

search.slidetext: start training start training start training start training start training start training slips, trips, and falls

objectives at the end of this training, you will be able to: determine the common causes and prevention of slips, trips, and falls. choose the proper ways to prevent slips, trips, and falls from happening inside and outside the facility. classify whether the situations may result in slips and trips. click next
introduction click next

uneven steps clutter in your way poor lighting trailing cables common causes of slips, trips, and falls click next obstructed view weather hazards floor or walking surfaces with uneven traction common causes of slips, trips, and falls wet or oily surfaces loose, unanchored mats or rugs occasional spills common causes of slips, trips, and falls

use snow cleared walkways going to your workplace. use handrails for support when going up or down the stairs. keep your hands out of your pockets while walking. click next ways to prevent slips,trips, and falls from happening take short steps or shuffle for stability. wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. outside a facility ways to prevent slips,trips, and falls from happening consider installing floor abrasive mats or replacing worn flooring. encourage workers to wear comfortable, properly fitted shoes. promptly report safety problems to your supervisor or manager. ways to prevent slips,trips, and falls from happening keep walkways and hallways free of debris, clutter, and obstacles. clean up the spill immediately, if it cant be clean right away then put up a wet floor sign. inside a facility ways to prevent slips,trips, and falls from happening
answer a answer b answer c directions: choose and click the button of the correct answer assessment click next

drag and drop drag and drop you will be given 20 seconds to answer this activity. drag and drop the phrases to the proper category. classify each phrase if it may result in slips or trips directions: quick game 20 seconds click next

thank you great job! continue continue continue continue continue continue slips trips unanchored mat boxes in the hallway ice patches grease from the machine stairs covered with snow extension wires on the floor dark storage room food on the floor carrying lots of boxes running up the stairs

slips trips unanchored mat boxes in the hallway ice patches grease from the machine stairs covered with snow extension wires on the floor dark storage room food on the floor carrying lots of boxes running up the stairs answers click next

ways to prevent slips,trips, and falls from happening consider installing floor abrasive mats or replacing worn flooring. wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. take short steps or shuffle for stability. keep your hands out of your pockets while walking. use handrails for support when going up or down the stairs. use snow cleared walkways going to your workplace. ways to prevent slips,trips, and falls from happening keep walkways and hallways free of debris, clutter, and obstacles clean up the spill immediately, if it cant be clean right away then put a wet floor sign. promptly report safety problems to your supervisor or manager. encourage workers to wear comfortable, properly fitted shoes. common causes of slips, trips, and falls obstructed view poor lighting trailing cables clutter and obstacles in walkways uneven steps or walking surface common causes of slips, trips, and falls loose, unanchored mats or rugs occasional spills hazardous weather wet or oily walking surfaces floor or walking surface that does not have same level of traction review prevention common causes slips, trips, and falls play play play play play

review congratulations! you have just completed this training. you should now be able to: determine the common causes and prevention of slips, trips, and falls. choose the proper ways to prevent slips, trips, and falls happening inside and outside the facility. classify whether the situations may result in slips and trips. exit training exit training exit training exit training exit training

incorrect the answer is floor or walking surface with different level of traction. smooth surfaces have a low level of friction that may cause slipping of passer-by. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct floor or walking surface with different level of traction. smooth surfaces have a low level of friction that may cause slipping of passer-by. continue continue continue continue continue continue which of the following may result in slipping of the passer-by? a. uneven steps or walking surface. a. uneven steps or walking surface. a. uneven steps or walking surface. a. uneven steps or walking surface. a. uneven steps or walking surface. a. uneven steps or walking surface. b. poor lighting. b. poor lighting. b. poor lighting. b. poor lighting. b. poor lighting. b. poor lighting. c. floor or walking surface with different levels of traction. c. floor or walking surface with different levels of traction. c. floor or walking surface with different levels of traction. c. floor or walking surface with different levels of traction. c. floor or walking surface with different levels of traction. c. floor or walking surface with different levels of traction.

incorrect the answer is trailing cables on always may result in tripping. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct trailing cables may result in tripping. continue continue continue continue continue continue which of the following may result in tripping? a. trailing cables. a. trailing cables. a. trailing cables. a. trailing cables. a. trailing cables. a. trailing cables. b. loose, unanchored rug or mat. b. loose, unanchored rug or mat. b. loose, unanchored rug or mat. b. loose, unanchored rug or mat. b. loose, unanchored rug or mat. b. loose, unanchored rug or mat. c. hazardous weather. c. hazardous weather. c. hazardous weather. c. hazardous weather. c. hazardous weather. c. hazardous weather.

incorrect the answer is use cleared walkways when going to your workplace, this is safer than taking shortcuts with snowy paths. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct use cleared walkways when going to your workplace, this is safer than taking shortcuts with snowy paths. continue continue continue continue continue continue youre walking to work in the snow. what is the safest way to do it? a. run while raising your hands on your way. a. run while raising your hands on your way. a. run while raising your hands on your way. a. run while raising your hands on your way. a. run while raising your hands on your way. a. run while raising your hands on your way. b. take the shortest way to your work even if it is covered with snow. b. take the shortest way to your work even if it is covered with snow. b. take the shortest way to your work even if it is covered with snow. b. take the shortest way to your work even if it is covered with snow. b. take the shortest way to your work even if it is covered with snow. b. take the shortest way to your work even if it is covered with snow. c. use cleared walkways going to your workplace. c. use cleared walkways going to your workplace. c. use cleared walkways going to your workplace. c. use cleared walkways going to your workplace. c. use cleared walkways going to your workplace. c. use cleared walkways going to your workplace.

incorrect the answer is report to your supervisor about the problem to take action immediately. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct report to your supervisor about the problem to take action immediately. continue continue continue continue continue continue you see that there is a worn floor in your facility area near the hallway. what will you do? a. report to your supervisor about the problem to take action immediately. a. report to your supervisor about the problem to take action immediately. a. report to your supervisor about the problem to take action immediately. a. report to your supervisor about the problem to take action immediately. a. report to your supervisor about the problem to take action immediately. a. report to your supervisor about the problem to take action immediately. b. put a wet floor sign to be avoided by your co-workers. b. put a wet floor sign to be avoided by your co-workers. b. put a wet floor sign to be avoided by your co-workers. b. put a wet floor sign to be avoided by your co-workers. b. put a wet floor sign to be avoided by your co-workers. b. put a wet floor sign to be avoided by your co-workers. c. cover it with a rug. c. cover it with a rug. c. cover it with a rug. c. cover it with a rug. c. cover it with a rug. c. cover it with a rug.

incorrect the answer is wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. continue continue continue continue continue continue you go to work and the road is filled with snow. what are you going to do? a. walk slowly while using your phone. a. walk slowly while using your phone. a. walk slowly while using your phone. a. walk slowly while using your phone. a. walk slowly while using your phone. a. walk slowly while using your phone. b. wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. b. wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. b. wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. b. wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. b. wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. b. wear shoes or boots that provide traction on snow and ice. c. keep your hands in your pockets. c. keep your hands in your pockets. c. keep your hands in your pockets. c. keep your hands in your pockets. c. keep your hands in your pockets. c. keep your hands in your pockets.

incorrect the answer is put the boxes down and clean the spill immediately; this can prevent you and your co-workers from slipping. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct put the boxes down and clean the spill immediately; this can prevent you and your co-workers from slipping. continue continue continue continue continue continue the floor of the storage room entrance is wet but you are carrying boxes to put inside. what is the best thing to do? a. do not put the boxes in storage. a. do not put the boxes in storage. a. do not put the boxes in storage. a. do not put the boxes in storage. a. do not put the boxes in storage. a. do not put the boxes in storage. b. walk quickly on the wet floor. b. walk quickly on the wet floor. b. walk quickly on the wet floor. b. walk quickly on the wet floor. b. walk quickly on the wet floor. b. walk quickly on the wet floor. c. put the boxes down and clean the spill. c. put the boxes down and clean the spill. c. put the boxes down and clean the spill. c. put the boxes down and clean the spill. c. put the boxes down and clean the spill. c. put the boxes down and clean the spill.

incorrect the answer is promptly report safety problems to your supervisor for immediate action. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct promptly report safety problems to your supervisor for immediate action. continue continue continue continue continue continue what is a good way to prevent incidents inside a facility? a. promptly report safety problems to your supervisor. a. promptly report safety problems to your supervisor. a. promptly report safety problems to your supervisor. a. promptly report safety problems to your supervisor. a. promptly report safety problems to your supervisor. a. promptly report safety problems to your supervisor. b. wear worn-out shoes. b. wear worn-out shoes. b. wear worn-out shoes. b. wear worn-out shoes. b. wear worn-out shoes. b. wear worn-out shoes. c. run. c. run. c. run. c. run. c. run. c. run.

incorrect the answer is use handrails when going up and down on stairs if possible. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct use handrails when going up and down stairs if possible. continue continue continue continue continue continue what should you do on stairs to prevent trips? a. run. a. run. a. run. a. run. a. run. a. run. b. skip steps. b. skip steps. b. skip steps. b. skip steps. b. skip steps. b. skip steps. c. use handrails. c. use handrails. c. use handrails. c. use handrails. c. use handrails. c. use handrails.

incorrect the answer is poor lighting can cause incidents, make sure to fix lightings for safety. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct poor lighting may cause incidents, make sure to replace bulbs when necessary. continue continue continue continue continue continue there is a burnt-out light bulb in one of the rooms in your facility. what is the best thing to do? a. let it be. a. let it be. a. let it be. a. let it be. a. let it be. a. let it be. b. lock the room. b. lock the room. b. lock the room. b. lock the room. b. lock the room. b. lock the room. c. replace the light bulb. c. replace the light bulb. c. replace the light bulb. c. replace the light bulb. c. replace the light bulb. c. replace the light bulb.

incorrect the answer is remove clutter on walkways. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct remove clutter on walkways. continue continue continue continue continue continue a. talk to your co-worker while walking around the facility. a. talk to your co-worker while walking around the facility. a. talk to your co-worker while walking around the facility. a. talk to your co-worker while walking around the facility. a. talk to your co-worker while walking around the facility. a. talk to your co-worker while walking around the facility. what is the best way to prevent trips? b. remove clutter on walkways. b. remove clutter on walkways. b. remove clutter on walkways. b. remove clutter on walkways. b. remove clutter on walkways. b. remove clutter on walkways. c. skip steps on stairs when going down. c. skip steps on stairs when going down. c. skip steps on stairs when going down. c. skip steps on stairs when going down. c. skip steps on stairs when going down. c. skip steps on stairs when going down.

incorrect not right, the answer is letter c. floor or walking surface with different level of traction. smooth surfaces have a low level of friction that may cause slipping of passer-by. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct thats right! floor or walking surface with different level of traction. smooth surfaces have a low level of friction that may cause slipping of passer-by. continue continue continue continue continue continue which of the following may result in slipping of the passer-by? uneven steps or walking surface uneven steps or walking surface uneven steps or walking surface uneven steps or walking surface uneven steps or walking surface uneven steps or walking surface poor lighting poor lighting poor lighting poor lighting poor lighting poor lighting floor or walking surface with different levels of traction floor or walking surface with different levels of traction floor or walking surface with different levels of traction floor or walking surface with different levels of traction floor or walking surface with different levels of traction floor or walking surface with different levels of traction
